snippet: The United Nations said Tuesday that at least 15 people with albinism, including children, had been attacked over the past six months in eastern Africa, where albino parts are prized by practitioners of witchcraft.
abstract: United Nations reports increase in assaults on people with albinism in Tanzania, Malawi and Burundi, where albino body parts are sought by witchcraft practitioners, who are reported to pay up to $75,000 for complete set; states over the past six months at least 15 people, including children, have been viciously attacked, and in some cases abducted, killed and dismembered.
lead_paragraph: The United Nations said Tuesday that at least 15 people with albinism, including children, had been attacked over the past six months in eastern Africa, where albino parts are prized by practitioners of witchcraft.

headline.main: Albinos Are Being Hunted in Eastern Africa, U.N. Says
headline.print_headline: Albinos Are Being Hunted in Eastern Africa, U.N. Says
